a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of primary-school-age children who are out of school vs. GDP

Children out of school are the percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in
primary
or
secondary
education. GDP data is adjusted for inflation and for differences in living costs between countries.
Share of primary-school-age children who are out of school
Data source: UNESCO Institute for Statistics (2025); Eurostat, OECD, and World Bank (2025)

Note: GDP per capita data is expressed in
international-$
at 2021 prices.
